meanings.definition: To make red or reddish in color.
meanings.sent1: She was ruddying the cheeks of the doll with a small brush.
meanings.sent2: The setting sun was ruddying the sky with its warm glow.
meanings.sent3: The artist accidentally spilled red paint, ruddying the entire canvas.
meanings.sent4: The blush of embarrassment was slowly ruddying her face.
meanings.sent5: The autumn leaves were ruddying the landscape, creating a beautiful scene.

meanings.definition: To become red or reddish in color.
meanings.sent1: The apple was ruddying as it ripened on the tree.
meanings.sent2: His cheeks were ruddying from the cold wind outside.
meanings.sent3: The thermometer was ruddying up, showing a high temperature.
meanings.sent4: The anger in his voice was ruddying the atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The potion slowly started ruddying in the glass, indicating it was ready to drink.
